header_summary: - Private collaborative custody services for Bitcoin can ensure user privacy with multiparty computation multisignatures like FROST, allowing blind signing of transactions by custodians.- Mainchain nodes do not validate sidechain blocks, but instead, sidechain nodes known as sentinels monitor Bitcoin for invalid withdrawals and publish attestations for accountability.- A fix and specification update for a feature involves replacing "OP_0 as pubkey" with the taproot internal key, with consideration for the proposed feature's hash contents.- Investigating anonymous credentials as a defense against botnets is suggested, along with anticipation for a game-theory formalization of the system dynamics.- PoW requires continuous hashpower per node to resist sybil attacks, while Lightning Network needs a sybil-resistance mechanism for trust-minimized offchain mechanisms.- Finding issues and protecting p2p networks against DoS vectors is highlighted, emphasizing the need for more contributors.

recent_posts.title: Private Collaborative Custody with FROST
recent_posts.summary:
- Private collaborative custody services for Bitcoin can ensure privacy through multiparty computation multisignatures.
- Collaborative custodians using FROST can hold a multisig key without knowledge of the public key or wallet.
- The process of enrolling a custodian involves generating a shared polynomial point and blind collaborative signing.

recent_posts.title: Sentinel Chains: A Novel Two-Way Peg
recent_posts.summary:
- ZmnSCPxj asked two questions about mainchain nodes and malicious code in sentinel chain software.
- Mainchain nodes do not validate sidechain blocks; sentinels monitor Bitcoin for invalid withdrawals.
- Sidechain developers introducing malicious code would impact sidechain users, but not Sentinel chains.

recent_posts.title: Combined CTV+APO to minimal TXHASH+CSFS
recent_posts.summary:
- Thank you for the fix and updating the feature specification with taproot internal key.
- The proposed feature will include careful consideration of hash contents for each mode.
- The possibility of mode 0 committing to spend_type and annex is discussed.

recent_posts.title: TOR enabled dynamic Proof of Work defense for onion services
recent_posts.summary:
- Antoine discusses defending against a botnet and suggests investigating anonymous credentials.
- The idea of bip154 was discussed but discarded due to constraints in real-world scenarios.
- Antoine is working on implementing Staking Credentials using elliptic curve-based cryptosystems.

recent_posts.title: Nucleus: Capital-efficient multipeer Lightning payment channels
recent_posts.summary:
- Proof of Work (PoW) and Lightning Network differ in sybil attacks prevention methods.
- In PoW, sybil attacks are impossible due to continuous hashpower requirement for each node.
- Lightning Network lacks sybil-resistance, allowing someone to run multiple nodes and manipulate funds.

recent_posts.title: Disclosure: Fake channel DoS vector
recent_posts.summary:
- Matt is praised for finding an issue and conducting thorough testing.
- The email stresses the need for more people to contribute and find issues.
- Protecting p2p networks against DoS vectors is challenging, more involvement is valuable.

active_posts.title: Blinded 2-party Musig2
active_posts.summary:
- A blinded statechains implementation of 2-of-2 Schnorr Musig2 is being implemented.
- Party 1 remains fully 'blinded' and does not receive certain key or signature information.
- The 2-of-2 musig2 protocol involves key and nonce aggregation to generate the final signature.

active_posts.title: Ark: An Alternative Privacy-preserving Second Layer Solution
active_posts.summary:
- Ark is a new second-layer protocol design that offers an alternative to Lightning network.
- It uses virtual UTXOs and doesn't require opening and closing channels.
- Ark enables anonymous, off-chain payments through an untrusted intermediary called the Ark Service Provider.

active_posts.title: Concern about "Inscriptions"
active_posts.summary:
- Storage for blockchain is not an issue due to factors like growth potential and affordable hardware.
- A 5TB hard drive costing less than $150 can provide storage for 21 years.
- Ongoing optimization efforts can further reduce the amount of space required by individual nodes.

active_posts.title: LN Summit 2024 Organization
active_posts.summary:
- Antoine Riard proposes organizing the LN Summit in Africa in June 2024.
- Africa's rich culture, fragmented financial systems, and growing number of Lightning developers make it an ideal location.
- Antoine seeks objections or feedback and plans to survey countries for suitable hosting options.

active_posts.title: Resumable channels using OP_CHECKSIGFROMSTACK
active_posts.summary:
- The proposal introduces a new way to make lightning channels resumable from a wallet seed.
- It addresses the issue of channel backups and provides a solution for fraud proofs.
- The proposal also suggests saving bandwidth and discusses alternative options without OP_CHECKSIGFROMSTACK.

active_posts.title: Jamming Mitigation Dry Run
active_posts.summary:
- We will conduct a "dry run" to validate local reputation algorithms using real-world data.
- Anonymized forwarding data will be collected in a CSV file format with specific fields.
- Local reputation algorithms will be implemented and data collection will prioritize privacy.
